name: Prenatal Care Interview Protocol
description: Comprehensive interview protocol for understanding prenatal care experiences, access to healthcare, and maternal health outcomes.

questions.text: Can you tell me a bit about yourself and your current life situation?
follow_up_prompts: Where do you live?
What do you do for work?
Who do you live with?

questions.text: Can you tell me about your pregnancy or pregnancies? When did you first learn you were pregnant?
follow_up_prompts: How did you feel when you found out?
Was this a planned pregnancy?
Who was the first person you told?

questions.text: When did you first seek prenatal care? What was that experience like?
follow_up_prompts: How easy or difficult was it to get an appointment?
How far did you have to travel?
Did you face any barriers to getting care?

questions.text: Who is providing your prenatal care? Can you describe your relationship with your healthcare provider?
follow_up_prompts: Do you feel comfortable asking questions?
Do you feel heard and respected?
Is your provider culturally sensitive?

questions.text: How often do you have prenatal appointments? Can you walk me through what a typical visit is like?
follow_up_prompts: What tests or screenings have you had?
How long do appointments usually last?
Do you feel you have enough time with your provider?

questions.text: Have you experienced any health concerns or complications during your pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: How were these concerns addressed?
Did you receive adequate information and support?
Are you currently managing any chronic conditions?

questions.text: What medications or supplements are you currently taking?
follow_up_prompts: Were these prescribed by your doctor?
Do you understand what each medication is for?
Have you had any side effects?

questions.text: Can you tell me about your diet and nutrition during pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Have you made any changes to your diet?
Do you have access to healthy food?
Have you received nutritional counseling?

questions.text: How have you been feeling emotionally during your pregnancy?
follow_up_prompts: Have you experienced anxiety or depression?
Do you have emotional support?
Have you discussed mental health with your provider?

questions.text: Who supports you during your pregnancy? Can you tell me about your support network?
follow_up_prompts: Does your partner/family support you?
Are you part of any pregnancy support groups?
Do you feel you have adequate support?

questions.text: Have you thought about your birth plan? What are your preferences for delivery?
follow_up_prompts: Where do you plan to give birth?
Who do you want present during delivery?
Have you discussed pain management options?

questions.text: What sources of information have you used to learn about pregnancy and childbirth?
follow_up_prompts: Have you taken any childbirth classes?
Do you feel well-informed about what to expect?
What questions do you still have?

questions.text: How are you managing the financial aspects of pregnancy and preparing for a baby?
follow_up_prompts: Do you have health insurance?
Are you worried about medical bills?
Have you been able to prepare financially?

questions.text: How has your pregnancy affected your work or employment situation?
follow_up_prompts: Does your employer support pregnant employees?
Are you planning to take maternity leave?
Have you faced any discrimination?

questions.text: Have you thought about the postpartum period? What plans do you have for after the baby arrives?
follow_up_prompts: Do you plan to breastfeed?
What childcare arrangements have you made?
Do you have postpartum support?

metadata.author: Synthetic Gravidas Research Team
metadata.target_population: Pregnant women and women with pregnancy history
